comments:
three projects:

1. aspectj project with the aspects
2. aspectj project using the aspects from 1. and provides some classes
3. java project (also tested as aspectjprojects) using some none aspect-classes from 2.

the classes in 2. are not available in 3.

all the structure works fine in eclipse 3.1 an aspectj 1.5

forgot the stacktrace. sorry:

Now the same for PC using 3.2 RC7 and latest version from AJDT update site.

I created an aspect plugin and imported it via update manager. When compliling another plugin (in another workspace) which depends on the aspect plugin, the following exception is thrown:

In your project properties for the failing project, can you try entering:

-Xset:activateLightweightDelegates=false

this will cause us not to use Asm - and we may get a more helpful message than an NPE...
Wow! After this setting (-Xset:activateLightweightDelegates=false) there is no more error at all.
*** Bug 160165 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
this bug cannot happen any more - regardless of whether -Xset:pipelineCompilation is specified.
Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991
